title: Newspaper headline font
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090529140801im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/lapresse_3994.jpg)
  
This font is used for headlines in a local newspaper. It looks slightly like HTF Verlag Black, but the G and Q are a bit wider. Any ideas ?

(this could be a custom type, it is a fairly big newspaper)
author: Der Kosmonaut

comments.content: Neutraface from House Industries is close.

<cite>looks slightly like HTF Verlag Black</cite>

i think it _is_ Verlag, G and Q and all.

Nah, I did compare and Verlag is slightly wider (as opposed to what I wrote in the first message). Out of that it is quite similar. And I’ve looked into Neutraface too, but the cross bar on the E is set very low and I don’t like it that much.

_»And I’ve looked into Neutraface too, but the cross bar on the E is set very low and I don’t like it that much.«_

In that case, have you seen [Neutraface Nr. 2](http://web.archive.org/web/20090529140801/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/neutrafaceno2/viewfonts)? But still not exact, I think …

Verlag on the left. Very similar, although especially the ‘S’ is different. Verlag with custom squooshing?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090529140801im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/sidebyside_4847.jpg)

Jan, my eyes must be calibrated differently than yours — those S’s look identical to me.

- Mike Yanega
Hm, to me the top overshoot seems greater in Verlag.
